result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabreen L Redd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation by January 12, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Sentence Credit of 34 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Disclose to any physician your alcohol history/dependency.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit for 150 days were granted. TIME SERVED.
All fines/costs/restitution previously ordered that remain unpaid, Court orders the defendant to serve 3 days in jail consecutive.  Sentence credit for 3 days were granted.  TIME SERVED.

Defendant Sabreen L Redd in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Case 14CF1418 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  34 days credit if revoked.
- 1 year Probation.  Defendant to report to Probation by January 12, 2015 by 4:00 pm.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Disclose to any physician your alcohol history/dependency.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
